title: Amazon’s Lord Of The Rings series casts Years and Years star Maxim Baldry
text:
Maxim Baldry has reportedly been cast in Lord Of The Rings (Picture: FilmMagic/FilmMagic for HBO)

Maxim Baldry has been cast in Amazon’s Lord Of The Rings series.

The 23-year-old English actor is best known for playing Viktor Gorarya in BBC series Years & Years, and also starred in Hollyoaks as Liam Donovan.

According to Collider, Maxim will play a ‘significant role’ in the series, joining the likes of Will Poulter (Midsommar) and Markella Kavenagh (Picnic At Hanging Rock).

Little is known about the series, aside from it’ll be set prior to events in Lord Of The Rings in a period called the Second Age – which ends with the downfall of Sauron.

Lord Of The Rings is one of the best film trilogies of all time (Picture: New Line Cinema)

Director J.A. Bayona (Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom, The Orphanage) will helm the first two episodes of the series, with the scripts written by JD Payne and Patrick McKay.

It was recently confirmed filming will take place in New Zealand, the home of Peter Jackson’s original Lord Of The Rings trilogy and the subsequent Hobbit movies.

Speaking about the series, Bayona said: ‘JRR Tolkien created one of the most extraordinary and inspiring stories of all time, and as a lifelong fan it is an honour and a joy to join this amazing team.

‘I can’t wait to take audiences around the world to Middle-Earth and have them discover the wonders of the Second Age, with a never before seen story.’

Amazon’s Lord Of The Rings is expected to go into production in 2020.
